STAT6.name: STAT6
STAT6.full_name: Signal Transducer and Activator of Transcription 6
STAT6.biology: STAT6 is phosphorylated and activated when IL-4 or IL-13 binds to their receptors. Activated STAT6 translocates to the nucleus and drives transcription of genes involved in Type 2 inflammation, including those for IgE class switching, mucus production, and Th2 differentiation.

role_in_disease.AD: Drives skin barrier dysfunction, itch, and inflammation
role_in_disease.Asthma: Promotes mucus hypersecretion, airway hyperreactivity, eosinophilia

flow_cytometry.description: Intracellular staining of STAT6 protein in blood cells
flow_cytometry.readout: % STAT6+ cells or Mean Fluorescence Intensity

targeted_mass_spectrometry.description: Quantitative measurement of STAT6 protein in tissue

immunohistochemistry.description: Visualization of STAT6 protein in tissue sections

STAT6.clinical_significance: STAT6 degradation >90% indicates complete pathway blockade, equivalent to biologic-level inhibition
STAT6.reference_drug: Dupixent blocks IL-4Rα upstream of STAT6; STAT6 degradation achieves same pathway blockade

TARC.name: TARC
TARC.biology: TARC is produced by dendritic cells and keratinocytes in response to STAT6 activation. It recruits CCR4+ T cells (Th2 cells) to sites of inflammation.

role_in_disease.AD: Elevated in AD patients; correlates with disease severity; recruits inflammatory T cells to skin

TARC.clinical_significance: Serum TARC is a validated biomarker of Type 2 inflammation in AD; reduction indicates on-target activity
TARC.reference_drug: Dupixent reduces TARC ~50-70% in AD patients

Eotaxin-3.name: Eotaxin-3
Eotaxin-3.biology: Eotaxin-3 is a potent eosinophil chemoattractant produced by epithelial cells in response to IL-4/IL-13. It recruits eosinophils to inflamed tissues.

role_in_disease.AD: Drives eosinophil infiltration into skin lesions

Eotaxin-3.clinical_significance: Reduction indicates decreased eosinophil recruitment; predicts efficacy in eosinophilic diseases

IgE.name: IgE
IgE.pathway: IL-4 → STAT6 → B cell class switching to IgE
IgE.biology: IgE is produced by B cells after IL-4-driven class switching. It binds to mast cells and basophils, triggering allergic responses upon allergen exposure.

role_in_disease.AD: Elevated total IgE in ~80% of AD patients; allergen-specific IgE drives flares
role_in_disease.Asthma: Mediates allergic asthma; target of omalizumab

IgE.clinical_significance: IgE reduction indicates suppression of allergic arm of Type 2 response; slower to change than TARC/Eotaxin

IL-31.name: IL-31
IL-31.biology: IL-31 signals through IL-31RA/OSMR receptor complex on sensory neurons, keratinocytes, and immune cells. It is a key pruritogenic (itch-causing) cytokine.

role_in_disease.AD: Major driver of itch; correlates with pruritus severity; elevated in lesional skin

IL-31.clinical_significance: IL-31 reduction correlates with itch improvement; nemolizumab (anti-IL-31RA) validates this target

IRF5.name: IRF5
IRF5.pathway: TLR/MyD88 → IRF5 activation → Type I IFN + pro-inflammatory cytokines
IRF5.biology: IRF5 is a master regulator of innate immunity. Upon TLR stimulation, it is phosphorylated and translocates to the nucleus to drive transcription of Type I interferons (IFNα/β), TNFα, IL-6, IL-12, IL-23, and other pro-inflammatory mediators.

role_in_disease.SLE: IRF5 risk variants increase susceptibility; drives IFN signature and autoantibody production
role_in_disease.RA: Drives TNFα and IL-6 in synovium
role_in_disease.Sj\u00f6gren's: IRF5 variants associated; drives glandular inflammation

IRF5.clinical_significance: IRF5 degradation blocks multiple pathogenic pathways simultaneously - broader than single-cytokine approaches
IRF5.genetic_validation: GWAS identifies IRF5 as autoimmune susceptibility gene

IRAK4.name: IRAK4
IRAK4.pathway: IL-1R/TLR → MyD88 → IRAK4 → TRAF6 → NF-κB → inflammation
IRAK4.biology: IRAK4 is an obligate signaling node downstream of IL-1R and most TLRs. It has both kinase activity AND scaffolding function in the Myddosome complex. Both functions contribute to inflammatory signaling.

role_in_disease.HS: IL-1 signaling drives neutrophilic inflammation in hair follicles
role_in_disease.AD: IL-33 signaling contributes to Type 2 inflammation
role_in_disease.RA: IL-1 drives synovial inflammation and joint destruction

IRAK4.clinical_significance: IRAK4 degradation blocks BOTH kinase and scaffolding functions - more complete than kinase inhibitors
IRAK4.genetic_validation: IRAK4-null humans are healthy → validates safety of complete inhibition
